p: Thymus species have been used since ancient times for the treatment of different health aberrations. The plant possesses a variety of the medicinal properties that positively affect human health ( Table 1). Authors were not able to find most of the specific parts of the plant used in traditional medicinal practices. Even though search was conducted using the words “root,” “stem,” or “leaves”, there was no available records for specific parts of the plant used for traditional medicine. Few available studies were able to depict the details limited to “aerial parts” of the plant, which includes stem, leaves, flowers, and buds. Also, these studies were not able to reveal the accurate use of the plant. Mechanisms of ethnopharmacological uses were not available. The information was limited to “whole plant” or “thyme water”. Investigations need to be done in this regard to decipher the unknown medicinal properties, which may benefit the pharmacological studies.
